This term encompasses a wide range of racial and ethnic groups, including Black Americans, Indigenous peoples, and people of color from various backgrounds. While it is not impossible for any of these groups to have difficulty sleeping at night, BIPOC individuals are more likely to experience sleep disparities and insufficient sleep due to systemic barriers and health disparities. Therefore, among the options provided, BIPOC is the most effective choice for a person who sleeps at night.
